Crouches down, opens a panel the closet wall. Takes out a little rolling suitcase with picture of Wolverine. Unzips it: The red and blue suit, neatly folded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still dark. Peter carries the suitcase down a deserted street and then out into a swampy waste. In the distance, HOMELESS MEN around a burning steel drum. Here, a steel d standing alone. The suitcase CLANGS against the inside of the drum. Peter takes out a can of lighter fluid. Douses the thing liberally, then strikes a match. HUGE, STUPIDLY HUGE FIREBALL. Peter leaps to one side. Kicks over the drum. Flame scatt everywhere. He jumps around trying to stamp them out. Far LAUGHTER from the men. Peter picks up still-intact suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Ouch! He shakes the costume out of the smoldering case. Picks it up off the ground, stares at it. The dead eyes o the mask stare back.  59. He stuffs the thing into the steel drum and walks away. D not look especially unburdened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HOMELESS MAN watches Peter walk away from the drum. He tacks a little unsteadily across the lot toward the dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter riding in a subway car, smudges of black on his fac Nearest him sits A YOUNG WOMAN in scrubs. Near her are a couple of MEN. They're staring at her. Peter sees it.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: I'm Jack. I said, Hi. I'm Jack. The woman was trying to ignore him. She blushes. Peter's spider sense TINGLES as he watches.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND MAN
dialogues.text: You don't got to be rude, bitch. Peter, sweating. His fingers flex. His lips narrow. His e meet the second man's. The train pulls screeching into the station. The doors op and the girl slips out. The men stand up as if to follow then sit back down. They laugh. One of them flips Peter off. Peter looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The homeless man stands across the desk from JJJ. Carryin the charred husk of the suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: JIT
dialogues.text: I hope you don't have the head of an extraterrestrial in there.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: JIT
dialogues.text: Because if you do, you're the third guy this week.  60. The homeless man unzips the bags and yanks out the costum It's blackened and crumpled but still gorgeous. Real.

dialogues.speaker: JJJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where the hell did you get that?

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN
dialogues.text: This guy left it in the garbage. Out in New Lots. First he tried to set it on fire.

dialogues.speaker: JIT
dialogues.text: Set it on fire? He takes the costume and shakes it out by the shoulders. Turns it this way and that. Then he grins.

dialogues.speaker: JJJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He's out. Thrown in the towel! Abandoned his sad masquerade! He-- A dark thought occurs.

dialogues.speaker: JJJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That loser! Quitting on me! In the middle of the best damn story I've had in thirty years! If I hadn't already crushed him, I'd crush him again just for giving up on me! JJJ is forgetting his visitor.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN
dialogues.text: Uh, mister...

dialogues.speaker: JIT
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. What kind of idiot does he think I am? A burnt costume! How heavy-handed can you get? Sure, he wants everybody to think he's quit. When, in reality, he's just going underground. Inventing a whole new identity for himself!

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN
dialogues.text: Mr. Jameson, please, I'm hungry. JJJ haggles, but his heart's not in it. He's staring fixe at the Spidey suit.

dialogues.speaker: JIT
dialogues.text: I'll give you fifty bucks.  61.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN
dialogues.text: A hundred.

dialogues.speaker: JIT
dialogues.text: Seventy-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter comes up out of the subway, carrying a knapsack. Pa of a stream of other students. Walks past an alley, sees THREE MEN standing together. No of them savory looking. Two are clearly threatening the third. They rifle the pockets of his jacket. They snatch little parcel. Slap him. Peter's face, wrestling with the problem. Should he do something? He takes a deep breath and keeps on walking. Hesitant at first, then steadily. INT. JJJ'S OFFICE — NIGHT Late editorial meeting. The costume hangs conspicuously f the door. STAFFERS keep sneaking glances at it as JJJ harangues them. JJJ picks up a front page proof. Headline: SPIDEY PLAYS

dialogues.speaker: JIT
dialogues.text: Spider-Man has put himself into a one-man witness protection program. He's in hiding. And it's going to be my personal mission, and yours, to root him out! Expose him to the light! There's no hiding from the truth, let's show him that! (beat) That's all I have so far. You people figure out the rest. They all get up and file out. Some groans. ROBBIE ROBERST turns as he's leaving, pausing by the costume. Sniffs.

dialogues.speaker: ROBBIE
dialogues.text: Lighter fluid. He goes out. Shuts the door. Jonah goes over to the suit. Regards it. Leans forward. Sniffs it. A weird idea comes into his brain. He starts t unbutton his shirt.  62. INT. JJJ'S OFFICE — NIGHT We're watching him, maybe through the window. He pulls th mask down over his head, completing the costume. Naturall it's not a perfect fit. He poses stiffly, movements awkward. Then he catches sigh himself in a mirror. Strikes a pose. Another. A parody of Spidey's characteristic moves. Finally he doe the upside-down hook'em horns webshooting thing. We leave having a shameless amount of fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next morning Peter wakes up in bed. Sits up, blinking pressing at his hip. He picks up Biomolecular Chemistry. Holds it close, far, close. Readable but a little blurry. He smiles. Gets out of bed. Maybe he's shrunken a bit. He goes over to a wallpapered wall and lays his palm agai it. It slides a quarter inch; he smiles. It sticks. He frowns. He creeps up the wall and onto the ceiling. Hangs there. Drops onto the floor. Not yet. He FIRES a strand of web. It shoots clear and thin. Then weirdly it SPUTTERS. FOAMS UP. He shakes his hand at the wrist. Shoots again. Another cl strand shoots out and hits his knapsack. Jerks it back to him. But something is changing.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: It's working. He's delighted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter comes flying down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Ditkovich! Ditkovich! He gives an exuberant little kick at the bottom of the stairs. Loses his footing. Falls on his ass. Ditkovich looks down at him. Peter's not even embarrassed  63.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What a klutz, huh? (grins) I need to use the phone.

dialogues.speaker: PETER AND MJ
dialogues.text: MJ is doing yoga. In Downward Dog pose when the phone rin

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: MJ? It's Peter. I-- I want to see you. She doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to take you out. After your show. Tonight. I thought we could have dinner. I've made a few changes.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: I can't, Peter. Even if I wanted to see you. Which I'm not totally sure that I do. I already have plans.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: With Otto Octavius? She's taken by surprise by this.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: I don't think that's any of your business, Peter. Goodbye. She hangs up, leaving Peter looking puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otto's singing in the shower. The shower is actually a hazmat-exposure rinse. He towels off. Singing "Tonight" f West Side Story. In his exuberance, he is being WATCHED by the Rig. After moment he approaches the Rig. Reaches up to touch it.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: (just kidding around) You jealous? Silly thing. You know what you and I have is special.  64. A moment of doubt.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Actually, I almost wish I could take you with me. Don't feel like quite such a fool with you around. Must be the endorphin push. He looks around. Peels off his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MJ's on stage, singing. We do a kind of Citizen Kane rise into the catwalks high above the stage. Peter Parker dangles by a thread. Upside down. Listening MJ's voice rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otto and MJ carrying a couple of dogs apiece toward the counter. It's very crowded. Otto's wearing his long coat.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Thanks for indulging me. I know it's a long way to come for a hot dog. But these are the best.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: I've never been to Queens before. Otto stumbles. Two 'pods shoot out of the bottom of his c and arrest his fall. He rights himself, blushing. No one has noticed but us. H takes a bite.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's a very good hot dog.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: I really needed it.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: I'm sorry the show's not getting any easier for you.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: It's like there's this pane of glass between me and the audience. They can see me and hear me, but they can't feel me.  65.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: I don't agree. I think you're the most marvelously expressive performer I've ever witnessed. MJ beams for an instant, then cracks up, then looks at hi

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: You're sort of gaga over me, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: Sort of. I hope that's okay.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: I know we haven't known each other for very long. But I-- He winces, and reaches involuntarily for his side.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: Bad back. Through the plate-glass windows we can see Peter watching them from out on the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otto and MJ stand a foot apart.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: So what do you want to do, now?

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: Would you like-- (f£linches ) Would you like to come to my place? My home, this time. Not my lab. I've been working on a Mozart trio. MJ (confused) You have another Rig at home? Oops.  66.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: Well, sort of. You see-- TWO BIG BAD MEN pass. One bumps into Otto. Kind of hard.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, watch it, man. The BBM ignores him. Otto starts after, with those freaky octopus eyes. Mo Otto... Otto seems to rise up, weirdly looming.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: I don't know why human beings persist in believing that mere physical bulk confers some sort of evolutionary advantage. The BBM feels a tap on his shoulder. It's a 'pod, natch.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Yeah? The 'pods snake out around Otto, fatal and alert. On MJ She looks fully as if the flesh of the guy that she's sor getting a crush on has suddenly sprouted four steel arms. Otto and the faithful Rig make short work of the two men. Otto turns back to MJ, hanging in the air. Aglow with the work out. Hurricane eyes. SIRENS in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: We wanted to show you what we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is watching from a distance as Otto bursts out into strange bloom.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Oh oh. Starts to run toward them. Then stops. Looks around. Sees

dialogues.speaker: EXCELSIOR SOUVENIR SHOP
dialogues.text: He dashes in and looks around. Finds a Spider-Man replica shirt.  67. Grabs it, and a Big Apple ski mask. Runs out of the shop the SHOPOWNER running after him. As he runs he pulls on the long-sleeved T-shirt and mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The arms retract and Otto comes to her, his clothing in tatters. She backs away. Turns. Tries to run. A 'pod lazily retrieves her. Whips her around. OTTO (plural voice) Look at us! She meets his gaze. He looks tenderly at her. SIREN getti louder.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: (normal voice) You're so lovely. The fingertip of the 'pod strokes her cheek with the same tenderness. Ick.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Get away from me! She tries to duck free of the 'pod. He won't let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of her. Otto turns. Sees Peter standing there. Laughs.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: We're out of candy, kid. You'll have to TP the house.

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: Put her down! He flies at Otto. Otto sidesteps him and, reinforcing his grip on MJ, starts to flee up the side of a building. On of the building they start to fight. A leaping pursuit across the rooftops. Elevated tracks in the distance. On the next to last rooftop before the trac Otto turns. The fight begins. It's not a fair fight; Otto his hampered by holding MJ. Otto looks at MJ: reproach in his eyes. Then he sets her gently down. And leaps over to the next building.  68. Spider-Man goes to MJ. She shakes his arm.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Go get him. Please. He's not bad. Peter peers at her through the eyeholes of the ski mask.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Do you...Do you love him?

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: He's my friend. He's angry. And dangerous. Please, Spider-Man. Don't let him hurt himself. Spider-Man nods. And goes after Otto. Chases him across t last rooftop before the tracks. Otto hesitates on the led Spider-Man flies at him headfirst. HITS and they both tum over the side of the building. “TRAIN SEQUENCE" (TR) They fall onto the elevated tracks that run alongside the building. A train is passing at that moment. They smash down onto t top of it and are carried along the rushing tracks. Otto rights himself. Gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: I'm ready. Come on. Spidey rises and then it's basically a five mile long ver of King of the Hill, at high speed. Or maybe the myth of Sisyphus. Otto digs at the head of the car, and Spidey co after him. And Otto throws him off, and Spidey comes afte him. Every time he falls off the train, something worse happen Spider-Man than the time before. It's brutal. But he alwa climbs back on. At one point Spidey manages to get right onto Otto's back gets his hand in at the root of the 'pods and grabs hold the Latch. Pulls on it. It SNAPS and swings free. Still attached. But useless. And Otto HURLS him off the train. Spidey climbs back on. After the Latch busts, Otto just keeps getting stronger. we notice that Spidey seems to be tiring. He's winded. So it makes Otto angry that Spidey keeps on coming. He kn Spidey off again, and then smashes in the window of the c beneath his feet, reaches in with his 'pods.  69. He starts yanking people right out and tossing them to th side. Spider-Man snares them all in webs. The last time, webbing SPUTTERS before it fires. Finally Otto rips the controls right out of the car. Then jumps off the train. Spider-Man wants to go after him. But the train is now hurtling out of control. He can't ju leave it. He stays. And it's a good thing, because a big L-bend in tracks is coming up. And the train is going much too fast take the turn. Spider-Man manages to get all the passengers evacuated to rear half of the train. Then he gets behind the first three cars (now empty), rig in down between, and cuts the lead ones loose. Gives them mighty push. They race ahead, smash through the guard rai and PLUNGE over the side of the elevated. Now Spider-Man has to stop the part with the PASSENGERS. jumps down in front of the car that's now the lead. Plant his legs against the speeding track itself. Railroad ties SNAP-SNAP-SNAP and the momentum slows. But not enough. Finally, web SPUTTERING, at the very limit of his strengt Spider-Man strings his own body between buildings with webbing, making himself into the focus of a giant slingsh with all those tons of train shoving right up against him And the train slows. And slows. And slows. And stops. The Passengers CHEER. Utterly spent, his makeshift costume tattered, gaping hol in his mask, Spider-Man hangs over the abyss, clinging to edge, held in place by the tension of his webbing against bulk of the train behind him. And then--

dialogues.speaker: AT HIS WRISTS
dialogues.text: The webbing gives out. For good. The spinnerets FOAM OVER like emptied aerosol cans. He hangs suspended for a moment. Then falls-- And is caught, by the Passengers. Leaning out of the fron windows of the train. They drag him back in and lay him on the floor. His mask so torn and stretched that you can see more than half his face. The passengers look down at him. Then AN OLDER MAN reache down and tugs the mask back over Spider'man's face. Looks at the others: Anybody got a problem with my doing that?  70. Nobody does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otto stumbles back into the lab. He's crying. He backs in the coupler and activates it. It advances to a certain po and then stalls. Tries it again; nothing. His hand reaches for the Latch. It's loose; he remembers

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: As Spider-Man BUSTS the latch while trying to decouple Ot

dialogues.speaker: PRESENT MOMENT
dialogues.text: A glinting black 'pod joins his hand on the Latch. They a together forever now. A look on Otto's face of inexpressi rapture or possibly unbearable pain. He sinks to the grou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early the next morning. One of the GRADUATE ASSISTANTS le lets herself in. Wearing headphones, listening to the Fla Lips. Nicest time of the day. Singing along, hangs up coat, turns on lights. Takes a mo or two to sense that something is amiss. Doffs the headphones. Turns to look at:

dialogues.speaker: THE EMPTY COUPLER
dialogues.text: Cables dangling loose. This pretty much freaks out the Graduate Assistant completely.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Professor Octavius?

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: Lies on the floor, naked, in the rig. Weird fluid seeping from the flesh/machine interface. The assistant goes for phone, stabs out a code.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is Gretchen McCord, in the Anansi lab. I need help. I need doctors. A lot of doctors. An ALARM begins to sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A special team of commando DOCTORS, extreme surgeons, rus along, wheeling equipment and gear. They're like Helmut Newton doctors, packing in a portable operating theater.  71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Converted to an impromptu surgery. Otto lies on a table w the 'pods wilting around him. The X-docs go to work. They're wearing mirrored eyeshades using laser instruments. It's a complicated ballet of machinery and surgeons and blood. The ANESTHESIOLOGIST monitors the EKG.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR 1
dialogues.text: Jesus! Look at his tissue! It's changing so fast you can see it.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR 2
dialogues.text: His autoimmune function is breaking down completely.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR 3
dialogues.text: The Rig's like a parasite...that's going to kill its host.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR 4
dialogues.text: Unless we kill him first by trying to remove it. The pace of the EKG ratchets up a notch.

dialogues.speaker: ANESTHESIOLOGIST
dialogues.text: I may need to give him a little more. So are we going to do this or not? The doctors look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR 3
dialogues.text: All right. Come on. The Anesthesiologist prepares to turn up the gas on Otto. One of the 'pods stirs faintly. Unobserved. It's diode pulses. Takes in the situation. The surgeons take up their instruments. From the pseudpod, a soft WHIRR as we travel down

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE POD ITSELF
dialogues.text: Into its systems. Impulses sent to a fabrication unit. A complicated organic molecule takes rapid shape, then a do more like it, and we follow them back out of the fab. The molecules are pumped directly into another system: Ot nervous system. Up the spine, toward the brain.  72. A soft feminine VOICE wells up, muffled. Almost sounds li it's saying, Wake up, Otto.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO'S BODY
dialogues.text: We travel up along his hips and chest, through his neck a up to

dialogues.speaker: HIS EYES
dialogues.text: They snap open.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: I'm awake. With a ROAR he comes to life. The ‘pods windmill and lash flail. A tornado or turbine. Within moments, Otto stands surrounded by bodies. He's bleeding himself. The servo of a 'pseudopod TRILLS softly. The other 'pods gather near it, and turn their attention as one on Otto. Darting, flexing, the 'pods go to work on Otto's wounds. cleans with a swab. One secretes an ointment. One radiate healing light. And one pours him a glass of brandy. He kn it back. Sighs.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All right. System report. He appears to be LISTENING to a voice in his head, a soft feminine MURMUR we can almost make out. Winces.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus, that's disgusting. How long do we have? (listening) I'm going to have to try the parity chip. He goes over to the tray. Of course it's not there.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Spider-Man! He stole it--or Parker stole it for him. (listens) No, no time to fab a new one. His VOICE thickens as he shift to the plural, as if anoth strand had been woven into it.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We need to find another means of attaining system equilibrium.  73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otto opens one of the X-doctors' portable lockers. Stacke with their rubberized scrub-jumpsuits. Holds it up. Yes, will do. The 'pods take it from him.

dialogues.speaker: THE 'PODS
dialogues.text: Go to work modifying the uniform. A blade. A needle. A he sealer. Then they hand it back to Otto. He holds it up; n it can fit around the rig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otto checks himself out in a mirror over a sink. Pretty styling. He looks closer.

dialogues.speaker: HIS EYES
dialogues.text: Colored storms race across them. The surface of Jupiter. This won't do. He picks up a pair of eyeshields. Electrochromic lenses that darken at a touch. He darkens them, then smiles at the man in the reflection: Doc Ock.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: Not bad for a dying man. INT. MARTIN BECK THEATER — REHEARSAL ROOM - DAY MJ is taking some coaching from a WOMAN AT A PIANO. Tryin find around a thorny note in her song. The DIRECTOR of Bride! pokes in his head.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: MJ? Talk to you a minute? MJ looks at the Pianist. The Pianist knows. Looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MJ's talking fast as he ushers her in.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Bobby, I know I keep screwing up my blocking in the scene with the couch.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: You've been fine.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: I've been working all day with Renard--  She sits. She doesn' She cocks She takes MJ's eyes 74.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Sit down. He slides a box of mints across the desk.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: No, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Take one. It's a proven fact that it's harder to cry if you have a mint in your mouth. t get it. Then she gets it.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: When is she coming back?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Tomorrow night. She's strong and in good voice, and she's all ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Well. I'm glad to hear that. It was a great learning experience for me, and--

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: I'm glad you feel that way, MJ, I really am. But, well, there's one more thing I have to tell you. her head, curious, no idea what it could be.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please, have a mint. a mint.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Allie Black is going to take over as the Shepherdess. And as Mrs. Frankenstein's understudy. fill with tears. She goes pale.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: What? Why? Bobby, why?  75.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Well, I just think, and Howard agrees with me, that it would be best. Overall. It's not you, MJ. It's the show. It's just not the best fit. For you. MJ is in shock now. She nods, rises, heads for the door. Before she goes out she turns back. Being brave.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Bobby, can I ask you something? Do you think I have any talent?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Talent? Yes. And guts. Looks, too, if you don't mind my saying so. But-—

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: But what?

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Come on. You'll be doing me a favor.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: You seem to have a hard time opening up. Really connecting to the audience. There's something broken way down inside of you that you don't want to let out. Most people don't. But actors have to. She nods, bitterly. She knows. She slips out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MJ stands outside the theater. Bills are going up over th posters, next to the words DEIRDRE DUNN, that read HER TRIUMPHANT RETURN. It's raining. Maybe it's even starting snow. She just stands there, crushed. FOOTSTEPS. It's Renard, walking into the theater. He sees her, and then starts to act like he didn't.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Renard?  76.

dialogues.speaker: RENARD
dialogues.text: Oh! (bad acting) MJ Hi. Hey. I heard.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: I should have known. I don't know why I ever thought I--

dialogues.speaker: RENARD
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's tough. I know how you're feeling. Somehow not quite sincere.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: No, you don't. There's only one person who knows how I'm feeling right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is on the phone. He's a wreck, battered, cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Center for Biomimetic Research.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Dr. Octavius, please?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Just a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I'ma... friend... of Dr. Octavius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Octavius has resigned his appointment. Who is this? Peter hangs up. Spooked. A KNOCK at his bedroom door. He jumps.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Yeah? Ditkovich opens the door.  77.

dialogues.speaker: DITKOVICH
dialogues.text: Pretty girl is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Peter races in the truck. Weaving through traffic. in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otto retracts the arms. MJ turns toward him. Sees there. Takes a step his way.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: Please. Come. You'll be helping us. We promise. As he speaks, one of the 'pods snakes beckoningly notices, and she shudders.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Otto, who is we? GUNNING ENGINE. Here comes Peter, tires squealing. Sees Ock real pain out. MJ Otto snatches MJ up again with one 'pod. Rises up on the lower pair.  97. And with the fourth, PLUNGES straight into the cab of the truck and grabs hold of Peter. Rips him out and tosses him aside. The truck crashes against a lamppost and splits open. A bicycle chained to the lamppost goes flying and lands wit clatter. Peter lies amid spools of cable and orange plast fencing. He stands up shakily. Now a HELICOPTER descends on the intersection. Squad cars arrive from every direction. One of the 'pods snakes up and grabs hold of the chopper' strut. Another reaches right into the whirl of the helicopter's rotors. His ‘pod takes hold of the rotor sha and with a horrible shrieking brings it to a halt. Then O hurls the chopper directly at the police cars. Watching the explosion, grinning, he retreats. He doesn't see:

dialogues.speaker: THE WEB
dialogues.text: That Peter has improvised, from orange fencing, across th intersection. It's crooked and lame but Ock stumbles. Los his balance. SLAMS to the ground. One ‘pod stays aloft, holding MJ. Peter runs to her, she grabs hold of him. He tries to pry loose. No way. Now another 'pod snakes in and grabs Peter bats him lightly aside.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: Tell your friend Spider-Man I need to talk to him. Then they're gone. Peter's alone in the rubble. Defeated. and then, abruptly, grim. He goes over to the wreckage of Nynex truck. Pulls out the toolbox. Opens it. Takes out a wicked needle-nose pliers. Holds it up. Should he?

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: They walk down the boardwalk in the snow. A few strings o colored lights. He puts his arm around MJ's waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to have a normal life. A life--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --that doesn't break your heart? That would be nice, wouldn't it?  98.

dialogues.speaker: PRESENT MOMENT
dialogues.text: He looks around at the smoldering wreckage around him. Th at the pliers. This is going to hurt. He JABS the knife directly into his hip. Digs around. The worst SPLORCH imaginable results. His eyes roll back in h head. He staggers. But he holds up the bloody chip and gr smiles. He looks around--needs wheels. There's the bicycle. A little bent. It will do. He takes pedaling after Ock and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter rides past LOOTERS, smashing store windows. A LOOTE holds up the television he has snatched.

dialogues.speaker: LOOTER
dialogues.text: Hey, look here, I got me my eight- armed discount. Peter slows, watching, frowning.

dialogues.speaker: LOOTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you going to do about it? Peter pedals off, slows again, turns.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You really should put that back. The looter, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: LOOTER
dialogues.text: Man, shut up. His friends laugh. Then there's a cry for help. Peter looks. Some other LOOTERS have descended on a SIKH who is defending his store.

dialogues.speaker: LOOTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yo, why don't you go back to Baghdad?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Hey! Everyone turns to look at him. Peter looks down the Avenu Far, far away, by the Flatiron Building, we can see the dancing glint of Ock's ‘pods. Then LOOTERS fall on the Sikh man.  99. Peter drops the bike, and runs into the midst of the gang They turn on him. The Sikh man crawls out of the melee, bleeding. The looters swell around Peter, kicking, stompi punching. He goes down under the surf of men. Then, with an audible WHOOSH, the gang of looters FLIES BACKWARD. It's like a blossom blooming. Peter rises to hi feet, bloodied but steady. The men come at him again but he makes short work of them, leaping, kicking, dancing. The Sikh Man looks on, throwing sympathy punches. The looters lie fallen around Peter. He reaches down to y the stocking cap from one of the men's heads.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you using this? INT. JJJ'S OFFICE — NIGHT JJJ is at his desk, on the phone. People coming and going The Spidey suit hangs in a nice class case.

dialogues.speaker: JIT
dialogues.text: Any sign of him? No? WHAP. From the boarded-up skylight. JJJ looks up. Uh oh. A foot SMASHES through the wood, splintering it, and then Peter, stocking cap over his face, lands in front of JJJ' desk. He goes over to the case, SHATTERS it. Reaches in a takes the suit. Holds it up.

dialogues.speaker: JJJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell do you think--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: It makes you look fat. He fires a web up out of the skylight, gives it a jerk, a then sails out after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spider-Man swings along the avenue, trying to catch up to Dock Ock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He catches up to him at Rockefeller Center and they fight the snow, on the ice of Wollman Rink. MJ gets away from O but then stays to watch. Each combatant gifted in his own way with power, agility, kind of grace.  100.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: Not bad for a couple of freaks.

dialogues.speaker: SPIDER-MAN
dialogues.text: Speak for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: I speak for us both. You have the greater power--power I need. But I have the strength of knowing what I am. I embrace my freak nature. I revel in it. You will always be fighting against it. That is why I will win this battle. And he does. At last Spidey lies defeated at Doc Ock's numerous feet. Doc Ock picks him up, and grabs MJ. He tak his cell phone out of his pocket. Coolly punches a number

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sits watching the destruction on television. Clearl drugged to the gills. The phone rings. He manages to noti

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: Your father's soul will soon rest in peace, Mr. Osborn. Meet me at the pier. Click. Harry rises wobbling to his feet. A strange echoin LAUGHTER in his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ock tosses Spider-Man onto his BIG NASTY SPINAL-CORD EXTRACTING TABLE. MJ he sets down more tenderly to one si He prepares the procedure. It looks like it's going to be extremely painful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's limo pulls up. Harry gets out. Looks around nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MJ revives, sits up. Groggy. Harry stumbles in. Sees MJ.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: MJ? What are you--  101. Otto turns. He has Spider-Man all strapped in, now.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: Hello, Harry. Come to watch? I guess you've been waiting quite some time for this moment. I suppose before anything else you'd like to know who put your father in the ground. Harry draws closer, fascinated. He nods. MJ hangs back. Otto reaches out and YANKS the mask off of Peter.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY'S FACE
dialogues.text: Horror. The memory of Peter and his father shaking hands. Spider-Man leaving the corpse of Norman Osborn. Masks beg to circle one another in his mind--the masks of Norman Osborn's collection, Spider-Man's mask--and one other, gr and grinning.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Peter? (dawning shock and horror) Peter! She runs toward the table. A 'pod lashes out and knocks h brutally aside. Harry goes to her, sees the blood on her cheek. Looks back at Peter lying on the table as a great, spiked vascular probe begins to descend on the torn form of his friend. The LAUGHTER begins to sound louder in his ear and the pr descends.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No! This isn't-- I'm not-- He stumbles to his feet, stoned and terrified, and lurche out of the laboratory. Ock swings another fell-looking unit into place near Pete head. All of the 'pods are working in balletic unison to prepare the procedure. MJ stands. She sees a big spanner lying on the ground. Pi it up. Tucks it behind her back. Starts to inch toward Ot

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Otto. Don't do this. You don't want to do this.  102.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: There's no way to avoid it. We only need pieces of him, really, but they're rather crucial pieces. She's coming closer to Otto.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If we could take what we needed without killing him, we would, but alas-- He flips a few more controls. Two of the 'pods zero in on Peter's head. One extrudes fo onto it. The other produces a clipper-head. With a few rapid strokes they shave Peter bald.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, that's not true. We're looking forward to this death. You know what's interesting? Humans always think of the killer instinct as something very primitive. A relic of the savage past. Now all the cruel apparatuses are in place. An urchin of steel spines, miniature 'pods, wriggle toward Peter's bar skull.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But the longer we spend at this level of evolution, the more we realize that that's just wrong. Think about it. Human beings have only gotten better and better at killing over the last fifty thousand years. This is what we're evolving toward... She's close enough, now. She raises the wrench, high and brings it down-- ZWIPP. A ‘pod lashes around the wrench and jerks it from hand. Another 'pod knocks her back against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (plural voice) Get away from Otto, bitch! Ock turns on her, and the 'pods lash out and hover, just above her, ready to cut her to ribbons.  103.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Otto... please. She climbs unsteadily to her feet. Looking him in the eye

dialogues.speaker: MJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Otto... hey? Look at me. Please? Just look at me. She crosses to him. The arms strike, and come within inch of her face. She flinches but doesn't give way. Then take another step toward him. Reaches up. Lifts the glasses. P into his wild, dying eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know that you're in there. I can feel you? Can you feel me? The arms WHIRR and twitch, impatient as hounds at the end their leash.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: Yes, MJ. I can feel you.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Otto, you are not a killer. Your work is not about killing. Your work is about making us better humans, right? Better at being human.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: Better at surviving in this poisonous world.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Why? Why survive? Just for the sake of surviving? Otto points at Peter with a meat hand.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: You love him.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Yes. I do. Otto's at the limit of his control. All his systems break down. The WHIRR of the arms ratchets up to a WHINE.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: I thought there was a place for me in your heart. The first place I ever felt like I belonged.  104. Distant sound of SIRENS from outside.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: There is, Otto! There is a place. For you. For me. There is.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO
dialogues.text: You might be right. There might be. Slowly, the 'pods snake up toward the rafters of old building. Lash around them. Pull tight.

dialogues.speaker: OTTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's find out. With a crash, he pulls the ceiling in. The walls begin to collapse in on themselves. A pillar tips over onto Otto, then smashes through the fl dragging Otto with it. Into the water below. With a WHOOSH Otto is thrust down deep into the water.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Otto plunges, ‘pods billowing up behind him. A streamer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter revives. Looks around. Stuff falling everywhere. He kicks and thrashes his way out of the surgical unit. Spid sense TINGLES. He sees, in slow motion: The central roof beam give way, with a mighty GROAN. MJ, leg pinned under a fallen slab of concrete. The inevitable trajectory that links them.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: He leaps across and lands under the beam just at it hits, muscles taking on a massive burden of wood and inertia. H Sags-- sags-- sags--stops. He squats under it like Atlas underneath the heavens. His face is five inches from MJ's

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hi. Peter gives away a little more. Faces four inches apart.  105.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Hi. The weight seems to increase exponentially. Three inches.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: This is really heavy. Peter sags again. Now their faces are less than an inch apart.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: I'm trying. I'm stuck. I think my leg is broken.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Least of our worries. CREAKING. MOANING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn. The grand old building carefully goes about the business of sinking into the river.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Otto thrashes in the Rig as the ‘pods struggle toward the surface. For a moment he looks like his namesake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is drenched in sweat. He's shaking. MJ is trying to free herself.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: If I could just--feel--my foot.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: MJ. In case we die-- But he runs out of breath before he can finish the senten

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: You do love me.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I do. She had better hurry. He is about to break. Their faces a nearly close enough for a kiss.  106.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Even though you said you didn't. Now Peter can only nod. No breath to spare. MJ's face brightens--she's freed her foot. She crawls out from under the slab, then under Peter's ar as he drops the beam. As it slams through the floor, he snatches her up, then fires a web through a place where t walls have collapsed. He yanks them up and out just as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire structure upends and then slides with a certai urgency into the East River.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Otto turns his face away-- And ten thousand tons of ancient lumber comes tumbling do on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry Osborn lies in the middle of the floor of a great, empty ballroom floor. A small dark island in a sea of parquet. He wakes up like Sal Mineo in Rebel Without a Cause, alon lost, abandoned. Stands up. Looks around. Echoes and ghosts. He wanders the empty rooms and halls. Draped furniture. Carpets rolled. Climbs the stairs. Stops at the door to his father's offi Hesitates. Goes in. There's nothing there except-- Something in the corner. A small piece of colored paper. He goes over and picks it up. It's a little, store-bought Halloween card. More ghosts. HAVE A BOO-TIFUL HALLOWEEN. Opens it up. “To Dad, Love Harry." He lets it drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Harry. It's your turn now. Harry looks around sharply. No one there.  107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see what kind of stuff you're made of.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No. No, Dad. He's my friend. He looks into the mirror over the mantlepiece. Norman is there.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN OSBORNE
dialogues.text: Is he. Your friend. I guess that's why he stole your girlfriend. I guess that's why he killed me.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Dad, I don't know. I'm not sure. There's a lot I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN OSBORNE
dialogues.text: "I don't know." "I'm not sure." Harry, you swore an oath! You put your word, your money, your name on the line! You swore to make Spider- Man pay. Now, make him pay! Harry's leaning his forehead against the mirror. It refle only him.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I swear. I swear! As he says this he POUNDS the mirror with his fist. It shatters and falls. Droplets of glass rain down. And ther the other side of the universe is a neat little room. A laboratory of some kind. A command center. A haunt. Harry steps into that other world. Hanging from a hook is grinning green mask. He reaches toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MJ lies on the couch. Her leg in a really big cast. Readi the Daily Bugle.

dialogues.speaker: WACKOS
dialogues.text: She reaches for a squeeze bottle that is just out of reac

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Peter! Peter? I can't reach the--  108. He's there. In his coat. Backpack on his back. Leaving.

dialogues.speaker: MJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Water. She falls back against the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: MJ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You said you'd stay.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Your mother's coming.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: You also said... that you loved me.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I do love you. I have loved you all my life, Mary Jane Watson. I just can't have you, that's all. The danger, the uncertainty. The hatred. I can't ask that of you. You don't know what it's like. This is my deal. It's my destiny. He nods toward the Bugle.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's he saying?

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: He's saying you're evil incarnate. Peter nods.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I'll call you tomorrow. He goes out. She picks up the paper. Her face crumples. S puts the paper down. Sees his CAMERA sitting there. Lumbering, in pain, she pulls herself to her feet. Grabs crutch. Hobbles over to pick up the camera. Then as quick as she can to the window. Throws it open. Snow blows in. sticks her head out.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Peter! You forgot your camera! He's on the street below. He turns and looks up. She lumbers out onto her balcony. We can see the divots that Ock tore out of the face of the building. MJ forms a quick resolve. Then throws herself over the si  He darts sure. She hits He looks building right up 109.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: under the balcony and catches her, awkwardly, but

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Do you know how amazing it is than I can trust you do that? (beat) You were given a gift, Peter. I want to share that gift with you. And I want you to share it with me. You don't have to do it alone. I'll help you.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: What, you think police officers don't get to be in love? Firefighters don't get to be married? That's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: But, MJ. This is just--this is just so much weirder than being a policeman.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: It is weird. (beat) But you've always been weird, Peter Parker.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Wait, did you say married? him, hard.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: I already know your damn secret identity! at her. Then around. Then he carries her over to the and, lightly, with just the tips of his feet, walks it. Hops the balcony and ducks inside with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this mean I get to see the Spider Cave?  110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no Spider-Cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sets her back down on the couch. Puts down his knapsac Then SIRENS. A lot of SIRENS. Peter goes to the window an looks out. Face grim. Well, you asked for it.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: Go. Go! I'll be fine. He starts to peel off his shirt. EXT. NEW YORK STREET — NIGHT The sky glows orange; flashing sirens. Spider-Man takes o into the night. MJ leans out of the balcony as he sails a to be who he is.

dialogues.speaker: MJ
dialogues.text: You forgot your camera! Spider-Man swings around a corner and straight through th heart of a burning building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a five alarm fire. Gas fed. 300 firefighters. And the junior Senator from New York on the seventh floor. He comes swinging out the other side, clutching a DISTINGUISHED GENTLEMAN and a YOUNG WOMAN DRESSED AS A MA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his lovely companion. He touches them down gently. ERT techs rush over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that guy. Look at him! You want to know the story of his life? No choice in the matter. No way out.  111. Spider-Man sails back up into the roaring fire, toward a OF CHILDREN, snatching them from the flames. Doing what h was meant to do.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Didn't get a single damn picture of any of it.
